gololang

Interface Range<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Collection<T>, HeadTail<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>

    public interface Range<T>
extends java.util.Collection<T>, HeadTail<T>
    Represents a generic value range.

    A range represent a set of values between to bounds, optionally with a step (or increment) from one value to the next.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • from

        T from()
        Gets the lower bound of the range.
        Returns:
        the starting value of the range.

      • to

        T to()
        Gets the upper bound of the range.
        Returns:
        the excluded ending value of the range.

      • increment

        int increment()
        Gets the increment of the range.
        Returns:
        the number of value to between two elements in the range.

      • incrementBy

        Range<T> incrementBy(int value)
        Sets the increment of the range.
        Parameters:
        value - the new increment.
        Returns:
        the range itself.

      • decrementBy

        Range<T> decrementBy(int value)
        Sets the negative increment of the range.

        this is equivalent to: 

         range.incrementBy(-value)
        Parameters:
        value - the new increment.
        Returns:
        the range itself.

      • encloses

        boolean encloses(T value)
        Checks if the range encloses the value.

        i.e. if from() <= value and value < to() (for positive increments, resp. for negative ones), regardless the increment value.

        For instance a range between 0 and 5 with an increment of 2 encloses 1 but don't contains it.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to check.

      • reversed

        Range<T> reversed()
        Creates a new reversed range from this range.

        i.e. swaps the from() and to() values and sets the increment to -increment().
